An electrophotographic photoconductor has been known in the art, in which a photoconductive layer is formed on an electrically conductive support, and a charge-distributing layer is formed on the photoconductive layer with the aid of a binder or a resin, for the purpose of providing an electrical contact between the photoconductive layer and the electrically conductive support.
In such an electrophotographic photoconductor, chiefly the number of photoconductive layers is increased to obtain a larger photoconductive area. However, in the case of the electrophotographic photoconductor, the photoconductive layer is deteriorated by frictional force generated between the electrically conductive support and the charge-distributing layer. This deterioration is more conspicuous in the case of the great number of photoconductive layers.
To overcome the above problem, a method for improving the adhesion of the charge-distributing layer and the electrically conductive support to each other has been proposed.
